trans-unit.target:
Giới thiệu về BLG LOGISTICS

BLG LOGISTICS là cái tên công ty được tạo nên trong lĩnh vực kho vận toàn cầu. Với kinh nghiệm và trực giác cho phép chúng tôi điều chỉnh để phù hợp với xu thế của thời đại, chúng tôi kết hợp kho vận cảng truyền thống với các dịch vụ kho vận hiện đại đa dạng và rộng lớn. Hơn một trăm địa điểm trên toàn thế giới, chúng tôi cung cấp hơn 16,000 việc làm. Khách hàng của chúng tôi bao gồm các nhà sản xuất ô tô hàng đầu của Đức cũng như các nhãn hiệu thương mại lớn.


làm việc tại BLG LOGISTICS

. Nhân viên là cơ sở cho thành công của chúng tôi. Mục đích của chúng tôi là cùng làm việc lâu dài với những người khẳng định hạnh phúc khi được làm việc với chúng tôi và đồng cảm với BLG. Theo cam kết về nhiệm vụ của chúng tôi, chúng tôi cung cấp các chương trình việc làm hấp dẫn và các chương trình đào tạo tiên tiến phù hợp với cá nhân , và chúng tôi thúc đẩy một nền văn hóa giao tiếp cởi mở.

về DACHSER

Công ty với trụ sở chính tại Kempten, được thành lập vào năm 1930 và là một trong những công ty tiên phong trên toàn cầu trong lĩnh vực kho vận. DACHSER đã chứng minh thành công trong nhiều thập kỷ rằng một công ty gia đình có thể tuyển dụng được nhiều nhân viên tận tâm và suy nghĩ sáng tạo. Các mô hình kinh doanh của DACHSER gồm kho vận, vận tải, kho bãi và dịch vụ khách hàng cụ thể trong ba bộ phận kinh doanh: DACHSER châu âu kho vận, DACHSER thực phẩm - kho vận và DACHSER hang không và đường biển kho vận.


làm việc tại DACHSER

Chúng tôi đặt giá trị lớn vào người lao động, những người đáp ứng các thách thức liên tục thay đổi với sự phấn khích và trách nhiệm. Chúng tôi nhìn nhận nhân viên của mình như các doanh nhân trong doanh nghiệp và dựa vào tự lực của mỗi một con người. Chúng tôi hỗ trợ họ thông qua các chương trình khác nhau (và phù hợp với từng cá nhân) để thúc đẩy trình độ kỹ thuật và năng lực cá nhân, và do đó tạo ra một môi trường cho sự hợp tác mang tính xây dựng của tất cả các bên vì lợi ích của khách hàng của chúng tôi. Do đó, chúng tôi tìm kiếm những cá nhân tự rèn luyện phát triển và thực hiện các giải pháp sáng tạo để phục vụ khách hàng của mình một cách độc lập và với từng trường hơp cụ thể. Chúng tôi cũng đánh giá cao những nhân viên thể hiện sự quan tâm đến các nước khác và các nền văn hóa của họ, những người tôn trọng con người và môi trường và đánh giá các cơ hội để làm việc độc lập, sáng tạo và có trách nhiệm.

về DHL

DHL có mặt tại hơn 220 quốc gia và vùng lãnh thổ trên toàn thế giới, khiến nó trở thành công ty đa quốc gia nhất trên thế giới. Với lực lượng lao động hơn 480.000 nhân viên, chúng tôi cung cấp các giải pháp cho một số lượng gần như vô hạn của nhu cầu dịch vụ kho vận. DHL là một phần của bưu chính và hậu cần công ty hàng đầu thế giới Deutsche Post tập đoàn DHL và bao gồm các đơn vị kinh doanh DHL Vận chuyển nhanh, DHL Bưu kiện, DHL Thương mại điện tử, DHL Global Forwarding, DHL Vận tải và DHL Chuỗi cung ứng. Công ty đã được thành lập vào năm 1969 tại Hoa Kỳ, nhưng đã được mua lại bởi Deutche Post vào năm 2002 và ngày nay có trụ sở chính tại Bonn, Đức.

Làm việc tại DHL

Vai trò trong Deutsche Post và DHL cũng đa dạng như những người đang đại diện cho chúng. Nhiều người trong số các nhân viên của chúng tôi dành sự nghiệp của họ trong vai trò khác nhau - tham gia thực tập hoặc ở các cửa hàng và làm việc theo cách của họ tại các phòng ban và bộ phận khác nhau (và thông thường ở các nước khác nhau). Chúng tôi nghĩ rằng điều này nói rất nhiều về loại hình của công ty chúng tôi và đó là điều mà chúng tôi đặc biệt tự hào. Từ lịch làm việc linh hoạt và một nền văn hóa cởi mở và tôn trọng các vấn đề cá nhân tại nơi làm việc và một loạt các chương trình thực tập sinh và phát triển, chúng tôi giúp bạn nhận ra tiềm năng đầy đủ của chính mình.

về Tập đoàn NAGEL

Tập đoàn Nagel là một doanh nghiệp gia đình người Đức với sự hiện diện quốc tế và sở hữu hơn 100 địa điểm trên toàn châu Âu. Tập đoàn số một trong những công ty kho vận thực phẩm tại Đức và một trong những công ty hàng đầu trên toàn châu Âu.


làm việc tại Tập đoàn NAGEL

Triển vọng của bạn với Tập đoàn Nagel là một công việc đầy thách thức và đa dạng trong một công ty thành công trên quốc tế. Bạn sẽ làm việc trong các đội liên ngành và quốc tế. Chúng tôi cung cấp các chương trình phát triển cá nhân cho việc quản lý hoặc hướng nghiệp đặc biệt, có nhiều lựa chọn và cơ hội thăng tiến.

About Rhenus Group

Rhenus Group is a global logistics service company with a turnover of € 4.2 billion. Rhenus has more than 460 locations worldwide and employs 25,000 people. The Rhenus business areas – Contract Logistics, Freight Logistics, Port Logistics and Public Transport – manage complex supply chains and provide a wealth of innovative value-added services.

Working at Rhenus

As a family business, the values that are lived out, jointly developed and shared in the family form the basis for our work together and represent our identity. Flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes and a friendly working environment – we ensure everyone is on an equal footing. Moreover, you are given all the opportunities and space you need to further develop your skills and turn your ideas into reality. Being an international logistics provider we are able to provide our staff with all the tools they need to pursue their chosen career.

About Hellmann

Founded in 1871, the company started with one man, Carl Heinrich Hellmann, using a horse- drawn cart to deliver parcels in and around the town of Osnabrueck, northern Germany. Four generations later, Carl’s great-grandchildren, Jost and Klaus, own and run the company with a worldwide network of 19,300 people in 443 branches in 157 countries. The owners have always been, and continue to be, directly involved in the management; each decision is taken weighted against criteria that reach far beyond short term outcomes. We ensure the long term viability of Hellmann so it continues to provide opportunities for generations to come.

Working for Hellmann

At Hellmann, we create and sustain a fun, stimulating and empowering environment that attracts, retains and nourishes good people. Through training, compensation and recognition we encourage our people to develop their talents, in an atmosphere of mutual respect and trust. The core of who we are resides in the fact that we are a family owned company and we are proud of that. We promote the essence of what it means to be a family throughout the company. We encourage our members worldwide to build strong relationships based on integrity, understanding and mutual cooperation.

About DB Schenker

DB Schenker supports industry and trade in the global exchange of goods: in land transport, worldwide air and ocean freight, contract logistics and supply chain management. Roughly 65,000 employees at some 2,000 locations around the globe generated revenues totaling 14.943 billion euros in 2014.

As a specialist in European land transport, both by road and rail, DB Schenker connects all of the important economic regions in over forty European countries via a dense network of regular scheduled services. The company also specializes in global air and ocean freight solutions as well as all related logistics services. Integrated logistics centers at the world’s most important intersections where flows of goods converge create an effective link between all carriers and enable a wide range of value-added services.

Working for DB Schenker

Only with the help of our staff will we be able to achieve our vision of becoming the global market leader in logistics services. This is why the professional and personal development of our staff is a topic close to our hearts. We therefore endeavour to fill vacant management and specialist positions as often as we can from among our own ranks. Your career path and career potential knows no bounds at DB Schenker. Our numerous locations both nationally and internationally offer you the chance to further your career as a manager or specialist in one of our diverse business areas.

About Panalpina

The Panalpina Group is one of the world’s leading providers of supply chain solutions. The company combines its core products of Air Freight, Ocean Freight, and Logistics to deliver globally integrated, tailor-made end-to-end solutions. Drawing on in-depth industry know-how and customized IT systems, Panalpina manages the needs of its customers’ supply chains, no matter how demanding they might be. Energy Solutions is a specialized service for the energy and capital projects sector.

The Panalpina Group operates a global network with some 500 offices in more than 70 countries, and it works with partner companies in a further 90 countries. Panalpina employs over 15,000 people worldwide who deliver a comprehensive service to the highest quality standards – wherever and whenever.

Working for Panalpina

As one of the worldwide industry leaders, Panalpina offers an attractive work environment and job opportunities. We reward outstanding achievements with performance-based incentive plans. Panacademy, the virtual corporate training and development platform, aims to upgrade the skills and knowledge of our employees and prepares the internal talents for international work assignments.

Panalpina strives to be the employer of choice in our industry. In order to achieve our corporate objectives, we have to attract the most talented people on the market and to keep our high performing colleagues within the company. We focus on people who embrace our core values, reflect in their behavior the Panalpina spirit “a passion for solutions” and who turn challenging situations into promising opportunities.

About DSV A/S

DSV is a global transport and logistics company offering transport services worldwide by road, air, sea and train. Since its foundation in 1976, the company has achieved rapid expansion and international presence, predominantly through a series of strategic competitor acquisitions. With headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark, and offices in more than 70 countries, and collaborates with partners and agents worldwide. DSV is listed on NASDAQ OMX Copenhagen.

The company is structured in three divisions, DSV Road, DSV Air & Sea and DSV Solutions. Its main activities lie within the European road transport (trucking) network, and its air and sea freight forwarding business. Jens Bjørn Andersen became CEO in August 2008. In 2014 DSV reported a turnover of Euro 6,517 million and EBITA of Euro 352 million.

Working at DSV

DSV employs approximately 23,000 people and is constantly evolving and expanding with the global market. Working for the world’s fifth largest global supplier of transport and logistics can open up many opportunities for you to develop your career on an international scale.

About Arvato BERTELSMANN

Global logistics means for us, being able to connect you with your customers anywhere. In our fast evolving world, the customer chooses the channels and dictates how service excellence is defined. We power the logistics backbone and orchestrate the multichannel fullfilment for B2C, B2B, store & retail fullfilment. With our innovative solutions and technologies, we ensure customer-centric operations and bring your omni-channel visions to life.


Working at Arvato

Arvato offers a wealth of job opportunities to bring out your best. There are now more than 70.000 people in over 40 countries working for Arvato – that is to say, for our clients. Whatever tasks and challenges we face across units and markets, we are united by one common goal: not just to satisfy our customers, but to delight them time and again with the work we do for them. This is demanding, but at the same time it grants us the creative leeway to achieve our goals. And it presents us with exceptional career opportunities. We are being encouraged to think ahead and take an entrepreneurial stance on doing business. An extraordinary team spirit, a co-operative management culture and individual support help us to not only meet any challenge, but to excel ourselves in what we do.

About Sealand

Back in the 50s the Americas had a shipping line they could proudly call their own. The original SeaLand was created by trucking entrepreneur, Malcolm McLean who gave the region its first dedicated carrier service while simultaneously giving the world its first taste of container shipping.

People loved SeaLand. It was a line built around their needs and it put them on the leading edge of innovation. SeaLand changed hands several times, but to the people of the Americas, it never stopped being their line. Even after Maersk acquired SeaLand and renamed it in 1999, people in the Americas still referred to it as SeaLand.

So after seeing how people felt and realizing what SeaLand meant to the success of the region, we decided to give it back. Reintroducing the SeaLand brand as a dedicated leading-edge regional carrier seemed like a natural to our management team. And since the relaunch, the support we’ve received has been overwhelming.

All of us are committed to seeing that the next chapter of SeaLand’s history is about the shipping Line that helped carry the Americas to the forefront of world trade and business success.


Working at Sealand

No matter where you turn or who you talk to at SeaLand, you’ll find the same can-do, Vamos Juntos spirit that defines us as an organization. Depending on who you ask at SeaLand, our tagline means “We go with you” or “Let’s go together.”

Either way, we’re seriously in it with the customer. It’s an assurance that translates into peace of mind for our customers and their cargo will arrive safely. And it can give our customers an incredible confidence when they are venturing into new opportunities for their business.

Vamos Juntos! means that SeaLanders go above and beyond what’s expected. That’s the advantage of working with a shipping line that values relationships and really gets to know our customers and their business.

Our tagline is a mantra that manifests itself in patient assistance, proactive service, ready solutions to the challenges our customers face — and of course, an incomparable can-do spirit.

About Seago Line

At Seago Line, we want to provide our customers with the best possible short sea and feeder container shipping services in Europe — from the Black Sea through the Mediterranean to the North Sea and the Baltic Sea.

For us, that means three things: running an extensive shipping network with high-quality equipment, maintaining operational flexibility and reliability, and taking care — really good care — of our customers.

Our direct, collaborative approach makes us easy to work with. We take time to understand customers’ requirements, and shape our schedule accordingly. Because we manage our fleet from a central operational base in Copenhagen, we can provide flexibility while preserving schedule reliability.

As part of the Maersk Group, Seago Line has access an integrated intermodal network that covers almost all markets. And with teams of local experts in over 40 countries, we are ideally positioned to support our customers’ long term business goals


Working at Seago Line

Working at Seago Line is inspiring, rewarding, and fun. Whether you work in Commercial, Operations, Finance, Line Management, or another role, you’ll be part of a dynamic, collaborative team with great career development opportunities.

Service excellence is a very important part of every Seago Line job. We’re always looking for motivated people who will inspire each other to make the difference for our customers. We stay close to them by thinking and working like a small business, with a flat structure that minimizes bureaucracy and shortens lines of communication.

As part of the Maersk Group, Seago Line can help develop employees’ skills and experience while opening the door to international career opportunities at sister companies.

About Safmarine

Safmarine is an international container carrier focused on trade to and from emerging markets in Africa and West Central Asia.

Founded in 1946 in South Africa, Safmarine has always had strong ties to Africa, its energy, people and vibrant culture. Embracing these roots has established a distinct way of doing business, which still sets us apart from our competition.

Today, over 1.200 Safmariners in 85 countries around the world share a common goal: to be the people making the difference in shipping. Our ambition is to inspire a brighter future through profound partnerships and a culture of positivity and optimism. To realise this we invest in people, in relationships, and in the way we do business.

At Safmarine we are committed to bringing a human touch to the world of shipping and to partner with our customers on every step of their journey.


Working at Safmarine

Our business is built on a simple idea: we’re the people that make the difference in shipping.

We want to provide our customers with the highest quality of service. How can we do this? By identifying and attracting the best talent there is. Maybe that would be you.

Safmarine is an ideal place to begin or build your career – whether you’re just starting out or already have work experience.

We want you to thrive, from the very first day you walk through our doors. We want you to seize the initiative, push forward and grow with us.

We’ll encourage you every step of the way.

We’ll ensure you get training and professional development help designed around your specific career goals. And because we’re a shipping company with offices around the world, you’ll probably get an opportunity to relocate to another country.

You’ll find that your colleagues are interesting, supportive and great to work with. You will work with a diverse category of customers, and make a genuine impact on the success of their business. And you‘ll get the space to advance your career.

About MCC

MCC Transport is a regional specialist handling all Intra–Asia containerized cargo for the Maersk Group in addition to providing feeder services for a wide range of regional and global shipping lines. Having operated in the market for more than 20 years, MCC Transport represents a group of service oriented and knowledgeable people providing customers with a wide-range direct port coverage and a large corridor portfolio in the Intra Asian market.

A trade specialist in the Intra-Asia market for decades, MCC Transport has the experience and expertise to help you steer your business through the ever-changing and rapidly growing market in this region.

This means we understand the requirements and dynamics of the Intra-Asian trade. We are flexible in our operations but at the same time maintain a strong focus on schedule reliability.


Working at MCC

Employed in Maersk Group shipping companies are people with all manner of backgrounds, ranging from recent graduates to experienced professionals.

The job variety is huge, but can be roughly split into two: maritime jobs and commercial jobs. Maritime positions are available for experienced transport industry personnel, or for people who have completed our entry-level shipping programmes. Commercial transport positions are available to people from a broad spectrum of degree disciplines and other backgrounds.

About MAERSK LINE

Maersk Line is the world’s largest container shipping company, known for reliable, flexible and eco-efficient services. We are part of the Maersk Group, headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, and we operate 610 container vessels providing ocean transportation in all parts of the world.

Not only do we power some of the world’s largest ships – we also propel the growth ambitions of businesses and individuals all over our planet.

Every day our 7,000 seafarers and 25,000 land-based employees at 374 offices share their expertise with customers around the world to optimize their supply chains, maximize their distribution networks and most of all realize their business potential. We are devoted to creating simple and reliable solutions for our customers, continuously lifting industry standards and enabling global trade in the most sustainable manner possible.

What we do is more than shipping. We deliver promises. Promises from customers and businesses all over the world.


Working at MAERSK LINE

When you join Maersk, you will find that the world is your workplace. Whether working overseas or at home, you will feel the exhilaration, opportunity and sheer scope of our dynamic international business from day one.

If you had to sum up the reasons for the Maersk success story in two words, we believe those words would be performance and values. At Maersk, we choose the best people and we encourage and enable each individual to perform their very best within highly professional teams, acting within the framework of our company’s values. We’ll provide the opportunity to achieve, and your achievements will be well rewarded. But our focus is always on long- term, sustainable performance – and to achieve this, we believe it is essential that all our decisions are guided by a shared framework of ethical values.

About DAMCO

Damco is one of the world’s leading providers of freight forwarding and supply chain management services. For more than 100 years, we have been providing our customers with transportation and logistics solutions that support the way they want to do business, wherever they are in the world.

We manage and serve some of the most advanced supply chains in the world; in a diverse range of industries. With a relentless focus on simplifying complex supply chains, we uncover efficiency improvements that enable our customers to cut their inventories, reduce operating costs, and make significant short-term savings for long-term competitiveness.

In every Damco office around the world, we have local people who speak the local language and understand the local communities. In key origin markets, particularly China, we offer market-leading capabilities. As one of the world’s leading operators in emerging markets such as Africa, the Middle East and Latin America, we enable our customers to access new sourcing areas, customers and business opportunities with our established network.


Working at DAMCO

Being a truly global company with 11,000+ employees in 100+ countries worldwide, we offer the scale and global scope it takes for you to achieve your ambitious career goals. Being part of a highly diversified group with substantial activities in the shipping, energy, logistics, offshore and retail industries, means that we can offer career paths, both for generalists and for specialists in a wide array of fields.

When you join Damco, you’ll find that the world is your workplace. You’ll work in a culturally diverse, performance stimulating environment. Working at Damco brings a unique blend of being part of a rich heritage and an exuberant, youthful, fast-paced logistics company.

About Geodis

GEODIS is a Supply Chain Operator ranking among the top companies in its field in Europe and the World. GEODIS, which is part of SNCF Logistics, which in turn is a business line of the SNCF Group, is the number one Transport and Logistics operator in France and ranked number four in Europe. The international reach includes a direct presence in 67 countries and a global network spanning over 120 countries. With its five Lines of Business (Supply Chain Optimization, Freight Forwarding, Contract Logistics, Distribution & Express and Road Transport), GEODIS manages its customers Supply Chain by providing end-to-end solutions enabled by our people, our infrastructure, processes and systems.


Working at Geodis

Transport and Logistics form a key sector in the world economy. As a major international player on this sector, GEODIS is geared to full satisfaction of all stakeholders, starting with its workforce, more than 30,000 men and women worldwide who share the same values of commitment, innovation, trust, solidarity and passion that form the pillars of GEODIS corporate strategy.

GEODIS activities offer a wide range of employment opportunities, for career paths consistent with individual skills and ambition profiles. There are openings for varied job functions in the 5 Lines of Business: Supply Chain Optimization, Freight Forwarding, Contract Logistics, Distribution & Express and Road Transport.

The talent of our teams is at the heart of our strategy. To support our development and reach our ambitious and sustainable goals, we need to attract and retain the best talents.

About APM TERMINALS

APM Terminals operates a Global Terminal Network of 20,600 employees on five continents which includes 62 operating port and terminal facilities in 38 countries, and 135 Inland Services operations in 39 countries. The company provides port management and operations to over 60 liner shipping customers who serve the world’s leading importers and exporters of containerized and other cargoes.

With world headquarters in The Hague, The Netherlands, the company helps to meet the constantly changing needs of the international trade community through high productivity operations and port capacity in economically, environmentally and socially responsible ways. Leveraging over a century of maritime industry experience and the strength of the A.P. Moller-Maersk Group, APM Terminals has grown to over USD $4.45 billion in revenue in 2014. APM Terminals’ goal is to become the port industry’s leading operator, and was most recently named “Terminal Operator of the Year” for 2014 at the Lloyd’s List North American Maritime Awards in February 2015.


Working at APM TERMINALS

In every corner of the world and in every business area, you will live the same core values. Competing in the market place in an ethical way, you are a valuable and solid business partner. You work towards the future, operating in a careful and humble way while demonstrating transparency and inspiring others. You conduct business at the highest level of ethical, environmental and societal standards in line with APM Terminals core values.

Since talented employees are the foundation of our company culture and success, your performance will be rewarded in a way that promotes continued achievement. APM Terminals offers employees fair, competitive compensation and rewards which include continuous development opportunities.

APM Terminals’ encourages you to assume ownership of your development with the full support of the organisation. To enable you, we offer some of the best learning tools and training programs within the industry. We partner with our leading professionals, run top talent programs and develop leaders to be role models.

Our growth ambitions and business plans call for the best people, generalists and specialists alike, to help us succeed in all markets in any economic cycle. Our job portal offers you the ability to search current job openings around the world. Lifting your career at APM Terminals starts with you.

About AGILITY

Agility builds durable, efficient supply chains that power businesses and drive trade, creating access to new opportunities.

Agility’s story parallels the rise of emerging markets in the global economy. The company got its start as a local warehousing provider in Kuwait and grew to become the largest logistics company in the Middle East. It acquired more than 40 logistics brands around the world, investing billions to build a global network with a strong footprint in emerging markets. Today, Agility is one of the world’s largest integrated logistics providers with more than 22,000 employees and operations in 100 countries.

Agility has two main lines of business. Through our Global Integrated Logistics (GIL) business, we work with companies in diverse industries and markets to move, manage, and distribute the goods that underpin global commerce. Through our Infrastructure portfolio of companies, we provide logistics-related services in emerging markets that facilitate trade and create access to new opportunities.


Working at AGILITY

In more than 100 countries around the world, we deliver personal service and local insights that help customers succeed and communities prosper. We move, manage and distribute the goods that power commerce and trade. That takes a global network, unmatched local knowledge and a diverse, passionate, talented team committed to going above and beyond.
